events.title: Caesar crosses the Rubicon
events.description: Julius Caesar leads his legion across the Rubicon River with the line ‘alea iacta est’ spoken as a declaration of war against the Senate, effectively transforming a civil war into a full-scale conflict.
events.significance: Traditionally marks the point of no return for Caesar’s march on Rome and the start of the Roman Civil War, reshaping Roman history and the fate of the Republic.

events.title: Alabama secedes from the United States
events.description: The state of Alabama adopts an ordinance of secession at its state capital, Montgomery, aligning with other Deep South states in the lead-up to the American Civil War.
events.significance: A pivotal step in the secession crisis that precipitated the Civil War and the eventual division of the United States.

events.title: The Italian invasion of Albania begins (contextual note: this date is often cited in relation to rising Italian aggression in the late 1930s; for precise day-year alignment, dates may vary by source)
events.description: Italy’s expansionist moves in the Balkans intensify as tensions with neighboring Albania escalate during the broader pre-World War II era.
events.category: Milestones leading to World War II
events.significance: Illustrates the mounting aggressions that contributed to the destabilization of Europe in the late 1930s.
